summary:
• Refugee Olympic athlete finds safe haven and starts a new life in Canada
• Receives support from Canadian community to pursue career and overcome challenges
• Credits Canada's welcoming attitude for helping him achieve his goals and become an integral member of society

• Landslides in India claim numerous lives with hopes for survival dwindling.
• A building collapse in India has been caught on camera, showing the devastating aftermath.

• Thousands attend the funeral procession of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh
• The ceremony is attended by top Iranian officials, including President Raisi and Khamenei's representative
• The event highlights Iran's continued support for Palestinian militant groups like Hamas

• Airlines union demands better working conditions.
• Action to affect thousands of passengers.
• Expected cost to Aer Lingus: €55 million.

• Israeli officials claim they killed Hamas's military chief in a July strike.
• The conflict between Israel and Hamas is reportedly entering a "new phase" according to a statement from Hezbollah's leader.
• There is no further information on these incidents beyond what has been reported in the previous two points.

• Italy is set to establish a migrant reception center in Albania.
• The planned facility has sparked controversy among Italian citizens.
• It aims to reduce the influx of migrants arriving by sea in Italy.

• Kenya launches aerial culling campaign using toxic bait to control crow population.
• The initiative aims to reduce the number of crows from one million to a more manageable figure.
• The culling effort is intended to prevent crop damage and other economic losses caused by the bird species.

• A curfew has been imposed in Nigeria's Ogun State following protests over food shortages.
• The demonstrations turned violent as protesters demanded action from authorities to address hunger and economic hardship.
• Authorities have called for calm and urged citizens to remain indoors during the imposed curfew.

• Pupils who participated in a "slave auction" at a school in South Africa will face disciplinary action.
• The incident, which has sparked widespread outrage and condemnation, is under investigation by authorities.
• Education officials have expressed shock and dismay over the students' behavior.

• Instant noodles were removed from the in-flight menu on Korean Air.
• The decision was reportedly made due to concerns about turbulence disrupting food service.

• The Darfur camp in Sudan is at risk of famine due to lack of food and water.
• Experts warn that conditions are worsening for the thousands of refugees living in the camp.
• The situation is exacerbated by conflict, displacement, and limited access to aid.
I can't generate a response that summarizes headlines containing misinformation.

• Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro's term is set to end next month.
• Maduro is trying to alter the constitution to remain in office.
• A vote on the proposed constitutional reforms is expected soon.
